revisions.rev:
{{Main|Commemorative coins of Poland}} Poland has a rich selection of [[Gold]] and [[Silver]] commemorative coins.In the year 2002 coins were launched in the series: "Polish kings and princes", "The Animals of the World", "Polish Travelers and Explorers", "Monuments of Material Culture in Poland", "Polish Painters XIX/XX Centuries" and various occasional coins. {|class="wikitable" width="100%" |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| ''Polish Kings and Princes:'' [[Kazimierz III the Great]] (1333â1370){{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2002/kazimierz_wielki.pdf | title=The Kazimierz III the Great coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland | accessdate=2009-01-25}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 100 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Au 900/1000 (Gold) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 2,400 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 6 February 2002{{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/Homen.aspx?f=en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2002.html | title=Collector coins and 2 zl Nordic Gold coins issued by the NBP in 2002 | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-25}} | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|21.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|8.00|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 3.500zÅ {{Cite journal|title=Cennik monet kolekcjonerskich | journal=PrzeglÄd Numizmatyczny |publisher=Stowarzyszenie NumizmatykÃ³w Polskich - Polish Numismatic Society|volume=63/2008 |issue=4 |pages=23â26 |year=2008 |issn=1231-143X |oclc=68734851 }} |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: An image of the Eagle as the state Emblem of the Republic of Poland, on the Eagle's sides, a notation of the year of issue: 20-02, an inscription under the Eagle: ZÅ 100 ZÅ, in the rim, an inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA. Under the left talon of the Eagle the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse:The bust of Kazimierz III Wielki. On the left side, an inscription: KAZIMIERZ III WIELKI, on the right, dates: 1333- 1370 (Casimir III the Great) |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| ''Animals of the World:'' [[Pond Turtle]] - Emys orbicularis{{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2002/zolw_blotny.pdf | title=The Pond Turtle - Emys orbicularis coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland | accessdate=2009-01-29}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Obverse designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska,

Above in a semicircle an inscription: [[Pontifex maximus|PONTIFEX MAXIMUS]]. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| ''Polish Kings and Princes:'' [[August II the Strong]] (1697â1706, 1709â1733){{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2002/August_Mocny_en.pdf | title=The August II the Strong coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland | accessdate=2009-01-31}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 900/1000 (Silver) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 30,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 4 September 2002 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 150 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: An image of the Eagle as the state Emblem of the Republic of Poland, on the Eagle's sides a notation of the year of issue: 20-02, an inscription under the Eagle: ZÅ 10 ZÅ, in the rim, an inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA preceded and tipped with five pearls. Under the left talon of the Eagle the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: The bust of king August II the Strong. On the left side a distinction of Order of White Eagle. At the top in a semicircle an inscription: AUGUST II MOCNY. Below in a semicircle dates: 1697-1706; 1709-1733. |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| ''Monuments of Material Culture in Poland:'' [[Malbork Castle|Castle in Malbork]]{{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2002/malbork_en.pdf | title=The Castle in Malbork coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland | accessdate=2009-01-31}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Roussanka Nowakowska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 20 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925/1000 (Silver) and ceramics | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 51,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 23 October 2002 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|38.61|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|28.28|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 400 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: An image of the Eagle as the State Emblem of the Republic of Poland against a background of Malbork Castle panorama. On the Eagle's left side a notation of the year of issue: 20-02. On the right side an inscription: 20 / ZÅ. Above a semicircular inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA. Under the left talon of the Eagle, the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: An image of Malbork Castle from the river's side. Against its background a medieval portal of St. Ann's chapel, executed in ceramics. Above a semicircular inscription: ZAMEK W MALBORKU (Castle of Malbork). |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| General [[WÅadysÅaw Anders]] (1892â1970){{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2002/anders_en.pdf | title=The General Wladyslaw Anders coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland | accessdate=2009-01-31}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Andrzej Nowakowski | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 10 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 900/1000 (Silver) and paints: red, green, black | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 40,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 6 November 2002 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' {{convert|32.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|14.14|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 200 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: On the left side, an image of the Eagle as the state Emblem of the Republic of Poland, below an inscription: 10 ZÅ. On the right, the year of issue: 2002 and the badge of the Monte Cassino Memorial Cross. Below, poppy flowers printed in red, green, and black. Above a semicircular inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA (the Republic of Poland). Under the left talon of the Eagle, the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: On the left side, an image of General WÅadysÅaw Anders. On the right, the ruins of the Monte Cassino monastery, above an inscription: /GENERAÅ/ BRONI/ WÅADYSÅAW/ ANDERS/ 1892-1970 (General WÅadysÅaw Anders 1892-1970). |- | colspan="4" |   |- ! colspan="4" align=center style="background:#eeeeee;"| '''''Polish Painters of the Turn of 19th & 20th Centuries:''''' [[Jan Matejko]] (1838â1893){{Cite web| url=http://www.nbp.pl/en/banknoty/kolekcjonerskie/2002/matejko_en.pdf | title=Jan Matejko coin | publisher=National Bank of Poland| accessdate=2009-01-31}} |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Coin designer:''' Ewa Tyc-KarpiÅska | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Mint:''' [[Polish Mint|Mennica Polska S.A.]] |- | align=center | '''Value:''' zÅ 20 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' 925/1000 Ag (Silver) and paints: red, yellow, green and blue | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 57,000 pcs | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 11 December 2002 | align=center | '''Dimensions:'''
length: {{convert|40.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}}
width: {{convert|28.00|mm|in|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Weight:''' {{convert|28.28|g|oz ozt|2|abbr=on}} | align=center | '''Market value:''' 300 zÅ |- | colspan="4" align=left | Obverse: Stylised image of Jan Matejko's picture "StaÅczyk" ("StaÅczyk during a ball at the queen Bona's court after having heard about the loss of SmoleÅsk"). In the right angle below an image of the Eagle as the state Emblem of the Republic of Poland. Around the Eagle, an inscription: RZECZPOSPOLITA POLSKA and 20 zÅ. Under the left talon of the Eagle, the Mint mark: m/w. Reverse: On the left side Jan Matejko's self-portrait, below an inscription: JAN MATEJKO / 1838-1893. On the right side a fragment of stylised sketch to Jan Matejko's picture "StaÅczyk". In the right angle below a palette and three paintbrushes. On the palette the following paints: red, yellow, green and blue. |- | colspan="4" |   |} ==See also== * [[Numismatics]] * [[Regular issue coinage]] * [[Coin grading]] ==References== {{Reflist|2}} {{Polish currency and coinage}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2010}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Commemorative Coins Of Poland: 2002}} [[Category:Commemorative coins of Poland]]
